channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Lindsey Vonn says she suffered 'complex tibia fracture' in her Olympic downhill crash
item.description: The 41-year-old star said her torn ACL was not a factor in her crash. "While yesterday did not end the way I had hoped, and despite the intense physical pain it caused, I have no regrets," she wrote.
item.content:encoded:
The 41-year-old star said her torn ACL was not a factor in her crash. "While yesterday did not end the way I had hoped, and despite the intense physical pain it caused, I have no regrets," she wrote.

(Image credit: Screengrab by IOC via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Nancy Guthrie search enters its second week as a purported deadline looms
item.description: "This is very valuable to us, and we will pay," Savannah Guthrie said in a new video message, seeking to communicate with people who say they're holding her mother.
item.content:encoded:
"This is very valuable to us, and we will pay," Savannah Guthrie said in a new video message, seeking to communicate with people who say they're holding her mother.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Immigration courts fast-track hearings for Somali asylum claims
item.description: Their lawyers fear the notices are merely the first step toward the removal without due process of Somali asylum applicants in the country.
item.content:encoded:
Their lawyers fear the notices are merely the first step toward the removal without due process of Somali asylum applicants in the country.

(Image credit: Charles Rex Arbogast)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Ilia Malinin's Olympic backflip made history. But he's not the first to do it
item.description: U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'End of Days' recalls the violent 1992 Ruby Ridge confrontation in Idaho
item.description: Author Chris Jennings talks the apocalyptic religious views that fueled the standoff between federal agents and the family of Randy Weaver — and the use of force rules that made it so deadly.
item.content:encoded: Author Chris Jennings talks the apocalyptic religious views that fueled the standoff between federal agents and the family of Randy Weaver — and the use of force rules that made it so deadly.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Japan's Takaichi to pursue conservative agenda after election landslide
item.description: Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, brought the ruling Liberal Democratic Party its biggest-ever electoral victory, fueling her ambitions to pursue to a political agenda which she says could "split public opinion."
item.content:encoded:
Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, brought the ruling Liberal Democratic Party its biggest-ever electoral victory, fueling her ambitions to pursue to a political agenda which she says could "split public opinion."

(Image credit: Keisuke Hosojima)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Olympic COVID restrictions are gone, but some athletes are still self-quarantining
item.description: For most people, the pandemic days of masking are behind them. In certain corners of the Winter Olympics, though, things still look a lot like they did in COVID times. Some athletes are taking extreme measures to stay healthy.
item.content:encoded:
For most people, the pandemic days of masking are behind them. In certain corners of the Winter Olympics, though, things still look a lot like they did in COVID times. Some athletes are taking extreme measures to stay healthy.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Herz

item.title: Mikaela Shiffrin has battled grief, PTSD and freak injury. Now come the Olympic Games
item.description: Shiffrin became a celebrity at 18 years old after becoming the youngest-ever skier to win Olympic slalom gold. Since then, she has faced grief, PTSD and freak injury — yet she is ready to bounce back.
item.content:encoded:
Shiffrin became a celebrity at 18 years old after becoming the youngest-ever skier to win Olympic slalom gold. Since then, she has faced grief, PTSD and freak injury — yet she is ready to bounce back.

(Image credit: Giovanni Auletta)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: The latest on the search for Nancy Guthrie. And, takeaways from Super Bowl 60
item.description: The search for Nancy Guthrie enters a second week. And, the Seattle Seahawks win Super Bowl 60, beating the New England Patriots 29-13. Here are the highlights from the big game.
item.content:encoded:
The search for Nancy Guthrie enters a second week. And, the Seattle Seahawks win Super Bowl 60, beating the New England Patriots 29-13. Here are the highlights from the big game.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: As US Olympians call for tolerance and LGBTQ rights, some face Trump attacks and online hate
item.description: President Trump called U.S. Olympic skier Hunter Hess a "loser" after Hess voiced concern about political turmoil in the U.S. Gold medal U.S. figure skater Amber Glenn says she's faced online hate and threats after advocating for LGBTQ rights.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump called U.S. Olympic skier Hunter Hess a "loser" after Hess voiced concern about political turmoil in the U.S. Gold medal U.S. figure skater Amber Glenn says she's faced online hate and threats after advocating for LGBTQ rights.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
